batchMiscs.name: NL Spa Reine Flat Mineral Water

batchHops.usedIn: English Bitters, Pale Ale, Porter, Stout, Czech Pilsner, Bock, Cask Ale, Wheat ...
batchHops.name: Progress
batchHops.notes:
Progress was originally introduced as a replacement for Fuggle and has very similar characteristics. Slightly sweeter and with a slightly softer bitterness it is has excellent potential at both the start and end of the boil.
Characteristics: Sweet flavour, Fuggle-like aromas of grass, mint and earth. Subtle bitterness.

notes.note: Bottles from the brew shed to indoors.

batchFermentables.name: Wheat Malt
batchFermentables.notes: Wheat malt can be added at 5% to most light beers to increase foam stability without affecting haze or flavour. Used up to 70% as a base malt for wheat beer, it imparts a bready flavour and characteristic citrus notes.

batchFermentables.name: Crystal Medium
batchFermentables.notes: Caramel and toffee notes come to the forefront in Simpsons' Crystal Medium. Their expert roasters use their skills to bring you a crystal that adds stunning deep golden and red hues to your beer, whilst imparting deeper caramel notes.
batchFermentables.usedIn: Pale Ales, Bitter, Brown Ale, Porter

batchFermentables.name: Low Colour Maris Otter
batchFermentables.notes:
f you need a well modified, high performing malt with a low colour, then Low Colour Maris Otter is the perfect choice. This heritage barley variety is used to produce an exceptional quality base malt, with a high extract and enzymic activity and low nitrogen content. Low Colour Maris Otter is kilned at a low temperature, making it perfect for Cask IPAs and Light Coloured Ales.

Beer Styles: Light Coloured Cask Ales and IPAs, Premium All-Rounder
Malt Flavour: Light Malty, Fresh
Usage: Up to 100%

batchFermentables.name: Amber Malt
batchFermentables.notes:
Gives a dry, biscuity flavour to ales and provides red hue.
This is very different from the much stronger amber malt from Thomas Fawcett.

miscs.name: NL Spa Reine Flat Mineral Water
NL Spa Reine Flat Mineral Water

recipe.author: The Thirsty Otter
recipe.notes:
Target: ABV = 4.1 %, IBU = 29, OG = 1.043, FG = 1.011
Tweaked the hop bill.
Changed liquid yeast for a dry yeast.
Malt is ordered with standard crush @ The Malt Miller (https://www.themaltmiller.co.uk/).
